page.title: 03GEOGRAPHICAL ASPECTS II
page.content: In particular, the steep slopes of the Gwaun valley give rise to a dense covering of mixed woodland.There is also evidence of woodland on the more gentle slopes of the Creini brook valley. There is an area of gently undulating plateau above the height of 80 metres. This land has been extensively used for agriculture. When walking around in the Gwaun Valley there was a distinctive smell of garlic and wild flowers.The vegetation cover in our area is very high and very little land is wasted.On our walks the sight of woodland animals was very scarce,which shows that life below the surface is much busier than above.
